item.title: Language Diary #2: Italian Crosstalk
item.description: Welcome back to my language diary. Which is apparently biweekly now with posts appearing on either Wednesdays or Thursdays, depending on how I feel. Yes I know bloggers are supposed to be reliable, but my whole “thing” is kinda chaos so forgive me this completely in-character 2 day buffer period.

item.title: Language Diary #1: Italian and making short-term language plans
item.description: I sincerely hope that future Elise will have a much better idea what she’s doing with this whole language business than today Elise, and with that in mind I thought it could be fun to start keeping track of exactly what I’ve been up to (approximately) each week. Future Elise can look back and laugh smugly at my mistakes.

item.title: How I Passed the Goethe B2 German Exam With a Nearly Perfect Score
item.description: Last week on Monday I officially went from monoglot to… duo-glot? Bilingual sounds wrong. I didn’t grow up speaking two languages. Anyways, as a newly minted official Goethe Institute certified B2 German speaker, I wanted to stop and share how I prepped for the test—and really, how I didn’t prep for the test.

item.title: 10 Great German Science Youtube Channels
item.description: German science videos were some of the first “real” German media that I could understand. It might sound like a tough place to start, but thanks to the overlap between English and German scienctific vocabulary, science videos can actually be a great entry into authentic German content (especially if you’re a nerd like me).

item.title: The best German Anki template ever. Probably.
item.description: After almost a year of experimentation, I’m finally satisfied enough with my German Anki template to dare to think it might be useful for others. So in the spirit of Mads Mikkelsen advertising a pretty mediocre Danish beer as “probably the best beer in the world,” I’ll say that this is “probably the best German Anki template on the internet.
